entry.title: sailing in Greece, September 2016
entry.content:
Sailed the Mediterranean with 5 other people

Tuesday September 27
Woke up in Athens in the Backpackers hostel at 2:25am. My alarm was loud enough to wake me from 10' away with earplugs, so I'm confident the other 5 people were awakened.
Stumbled upon the x95 bus in Syntagma square a minute before it departed at 2:50am
I had checked in online Monday. This was useful, as I wasn't able to get a paper ticket from the self checkin kiosk.
Swiss airlines is great - breakfast was a yummy egg, cheese, and tomato quiche with orange juice. A flight attendant accidentally give me a second serving, which I happily ate.
Most of the flight to Zurich was spent reading a book I picked up in the hostel.


Monday, September 26
Woke around 7:30am in Fira backpackers hostel. Showered, walked to a bakery for a pastry after eating a packet of oatmeal.
Caught 11:30am  bus to the port for €2.40, a 25 minute ride
The first boat to arrive was Champion Jet 2, 35 minutes late. I got on and was told that I should wait for the next boat (my ticket was for 13:10). The boat I got on was much smaller. I'm confined to the bottom floor and there is no outside access. Smaller boat means more shaking and rolling. 

Food today: 
Oatmeal packet
Spinach pastry
Nut bar
Bag of mixed nuts and raisins 
Baklava and milk


Sunday,  September 25
Woke around 8am in Fira backpackers hostel 
Talked to an Asian girl over breakfast of 3 oatmeal packets. Kasin is a graphic design undergrad from Montreal, Canada. Baptist who goes to raves. Came to Athens via a dating website 
Hung out with Kasin until noon
€2.40 bus and 45 minutes to Perissa beach
€5 umbrella fee. Meditated and peed in the ocean. 
Bus back to Fira around 5:45pm
Read a book, The Magician of Lhasa. Very good - I finished the 250+ pages around 12:45am. To sleep after 1am


Saturday Sept 24
Woke in Zea marina, Athens, to my alarm at 5:38am. Although it was quiet overnight, the smell of sewage was strong and interfered with my sleep.
Found Frank waiting at the taxi at 5:56am. Drove to the ferry terminal. Cost was €10 because Frank had pre-arranged the taxi, whereas Friday it had cost €3.5 and €4 when we caught Taxis on the street.
"Champion Jet 2" costs €43.70 to Santorini and departed at 7am. It's about half full, so I was able to find a nice seat by the window with an outlet for charging my phone.
Caught the sunrise as we departed Athens. 
Later lost my sunglasses in the wind as we passed the island of Kea
Arrived in Mikonos at 10:10am, departed 10:20
37°27'49.9"N 25°19'28.1"E
http://maps.google.com/?q=37.463861,25.324475&hl=en&gl=us
Next to Naxos. Arrived 11:05, departed 11
http://maps.google.com/?q=37.105913,25.372589&hl=en&gl=us
Arrived santorini at 12:45
Bus to Fira town center bus station for €2.70
Walked to the nearest hostel 
€16 
Bus to Oia, €1.80. Talked with a girl spending a semester in Italy. 
Wandering the town, there are plenty of tourists. 
The girls seem to be competing with the environment for most beautiful with the effort made very clear
Walked down the 200+ steps in Oia to the water. Wandered to a swim spot (Amoudi Bay) and went for a swim.
Back up the steps to the Byzantine Castle Ruins
http://maps.google.com/?cid=14861198028050229381&hl=en&gl=us
Waited 1.5 hours for the sunset at 7:12. I meditated and watched people to pass the time.
Caught the bus at 8pm back to Fira.
In bed around 10pm
Nice overlook, secluded:
https://goo.gl/maps/QFR7xcjMbYE2
Bus station 
https://goo.gl/maps/VdtFRFSfeWK2


Friday September 23
Woke in Poros. No water, a broken head, and everyone looking forward to returning to the base in Athens 
Motored, then sailed for 30 minutes, then motored. 
Arrived at Zea marina around 3:30pm 
Water pump was replaced. Sandy did the boat debriefing. 
"No tomorrow party" on Sheri's boat at 5pm. Lots of snacks. Frank and I went to the prieus port to buy ferry tickets but the office was closed. 

Sandy, Pat, Debora, Teresa, and I went to the nearby restaurant where Sandy ordered too much food and I helped eat some.
I went to be around 10:30pm. Sandy woke me up at 11:45 to help her and John get to the taxi. I went back to sleep quickly 


Thursday September 22
Woke in Mandraki bay around 7am
https://goo.gl/maps/VfzKXNwCNi92
Very peaceful and calm environment. 
I took pat and Debra into shore with the dingy. They walked to Hydra and took a water taxi back to the boat 
Cast off around 10am
Motored towards Poros due to weather forecast for thunderstorms 
Sailed for a while 
Arrived in Poros around noon (13 nautical miles)
Ate lunch on the boat. I ate too much and was dehydrated, so I took a nap while everyone else wandered.
Where we docked there was a house under active construction. There were about 10 men, ages 30 to 60, loafing around doing minimal actions. It didn't look like an American work site.

Dinner at Apagio Taverna


Wednesday September 21
Woke in Skindos bay, island of Dokos. Slept well - ear plugs were well seated and there was no noise. Made hash browns and scrambled eggs. Went swimming.  Departed 11am
Motored to Mandraki bay. Set a Bohemian mooring with two stern lines. We snacked. A squall blew past and missed us.
I set a third line to shore from the midship cleat. Used the dinghy to bring Sandy, John, and Pat to shore. John, Sandy, and I walked to Hydra for provisions. We took a water taxi back to the boat. 
I took the dinghy to the other two boats. I picked up more olive oil from Sheri.
Pat made pasta for supper. 


Tuesday September 20
Woke in Plaka. I had been up for a while. Overnight the wind was gusty - the waves sounded like arrhythmic bongos against the hulls. 
At 7am I stretched, pooped, then swam. The ocean was not cold and is very clear with a slight aqua tint. I used the warm shower on the beach, then went back to the boat for a bit more yoga.
At 9am we took Taxis to Monastery of Elona
The road is twisty and narrow. A monk and nun, both old, were present. The Munk guided us around.
Motored out of Plaka. Sailed for 30 minutes. 
Bohemian Moore in skindos bay. 

https://goo.gl/maps/LVbpSps2Bpm

I swam the line to the rock. Supper of spaghetti and tuna.


Monday September 19
Woke in Nafplio before dawn. A motorboat next to us had its motor running all night. That, plus the smell of raw sewage resulted in little sleep
Our neighbors had put a second anchor on our boat Sunday evening, so I got ready to release their anchor when they woke. We weren't able to get it up, so we ate breakfast. 
Did yoga on the dock.
Motor sailed with the main to Plaka. A squall hit us just before we entered the harbor. 
We rafted with Hope's boat and Sheri's boat; our boat in the middle.
Bought food at 2 grocery stores, as tomorrow we will be on anchor. 
I made hor dourves: oil soaked toast, cream cheese, bacon, and local tomatoes.  
Lots of drama with incoming boats due to the gusting winds


Sunday September 18
Woke in Nafplio before dawn. Did yoga on the dock.
Walked over to the beach to poop in the public toilet. Walked up the stairs 2/3 of the way up the fort. Meditated until 8am
Walked back to the boat for breakfast of corn flakes. I finished off the Pringles and Doritos. Had orange juice and did the dishes
Gene and Sandy picked up a rental van. Gene drove us to Mycenae which is a bunch of 3500 year old ruins. €12 entrance fee. Lions gate is a well preserved entrance. Next we drove 200 m down the hill to the Treasury of Atreus, an impressive tomb.
Lunch stop
Drove to Epidauras. €12 entrance fee. Another amphitheater and more ruins. 


Saturday September 17
Woke in Nafplio before dawn. Did yoga and tai  chi on the dock
Did the dishes 
Breakfast of corn flakes and orange juice 
Walked up the fortress, about 860 stairs, with John. Took 45 minutes at a leisurely pace. Decided not to pay €8 entrance fee at the top. Great view of the town. Highlight of the trip so far. A group of school students were going down, and we met a few people going up and down. Did not feel crowded
At the base we wandered a large open air market. Clothing, fruit, and fish. 
John got free grapes. I bought dates and raisins. 
John left in search of a pool we had seen from the fort. I went to the public beach. There is exercise equipment in front of the beach.
I hid in the shadows to avoid sun. 
I bought two ears of corn and 2 peaches. I boiled the corn for lunch and ate the peaches while I waited. I took a nap in the boat after lunch. 
Went to dinner with sandy, pat, Teresa, and Debra. Teresa and I split a fried squid. Fresh and tender; the best I've ever had. 


Friday September 16
Woke in Porto Kheli
Sheri was at the helm for the first hour, then I drove almost all the way to Nafplion.  Ate cold cut sandwich for lunch. Marsha was on the phone with the state department talking with the duty officer about Zonia.


Thursday September 15
Woke in Hydra
Departed 9:30am 
Motored to Vaiza. 
Swam
Motored to Porto Kheli, arrived 3:30pm 
Zonia had a medical issue 
Sandy, Pat, Debora, Teresa, and I took a small motor boat to spetsi  (€100 round trip, €20 per person). I found a cotton long sleeve shirt for €20. We walked from the new harbor to the old harbor. We walked back and had supper. I ordered Moussaka. 
Back to the sail boat by 9pm


Wednesday September 14
Woke up in hydra before 6am on floor of cockpit 
6 bells at 6am
1 bell at 6:30
Crazy bells at 7am
First boat started raising anchor 7:05
Wrote 14 postcards
Bought 7 cases of water, €2 per case. That's in addition to the original 8
Gyro for lunch, €2.5
Group dinner: fried cheese, zucchini balls, eggplant, . I ordered grilled sword fish. I helped Zonia and Cherie eat their meat (sausage, chicken, lamb, pork)


Tuesday September 13
Woke up at 6:45 by Sandy announcing it was time to get up. Left Ermioni around 7am just in time to catch the sunrise as we motored to Hydra. Calm sea with light wind
Approach to Hydra was pretty.
Port of Hydra is small given the number of boats. Stacked 3 deep, almost all med moorings. Sandy attempted to keep our boat away from other boats in increasing wind. Lots of anchors caught on chains as people left. Sandy waited until a spot on the quay opened. 
I made scrambled eggs for a late lunch
I walked up the hill through the village 
Sandy and I ate lunch around 2pm. I had a kebab gyro. 
I went swimming 
I had a late dinner of Red Snapper with John.
Found a pastry shop and bought baklava 


Monday, September 12
Woke at 8am to a church bell on Poros.
I made breakfast of French toast. Bought ice (4 kg for €2) and milk.
Departed Poros around 9:30. Motored to a swim spot, Nisos Soupia. I swam to the island. Then I helped make egg salad sandwiches for lunch. I found out there are many ways to prepare the eggs (chopped rather than mashed, with onions, etc). Also, Pat and Debra were ok with shells in the egg salad!
Motored to Ermioni after lunch 
Med mooring in a squall 
6 of us ate together at a taverna. I had squid again and it was chewy 


Sunday, Sept 11
Slept on the floor of the cockpit. Good temperature and rain wasn't bothersome 
Woke around 8am
Grocery store was not open, so we bought water, pastries, and coffee from a store near the marina.
Chocolate pastry soaked in honey was overwhelming. Spinach pastries were a hit. 
Sailed from zea marina to the coast of Aigina. I took some pictures. Then we lost wind and motor sailed to Poros
We rafted 3 deep off the dock; we were in the middle 
John and I wandered the shore and walked up through a quaint village to a church on a hill. Watched the sunset over Poros. 
Walked to a restaurant recommended by a local. John ordered cod which was amazing. My fried squid was chewy. Two lessons: ask for tap water; make sure the fish is fresh rather than frozen. 
I bought rum. Made mixed drinks for John and myself.
I slept on the cockpit floor again and it rained again 


Saturday, September 10
Woke around 8am. 
Stretched.
Ate breakfast at President hotel. Spinach pastries
Swam in the pool on the roof
Taxi with John and Teresa to Zea marina at noon
Waited while John and Sandy got briefings 
Went food shopping with Pat and Debra 
Boat checkout around 5:30pm
Dinner at a Greek restaurant with Sandy, Pat, Debora, and Teresa. Started raining 


Friday September 9
Woke 9:38am. 15 hours of sleep!
Showered 
Yoga on rooftop balcony 
Applied sunscreen 
Checked out 
Walked to President hotel 
Passed the first Olympic Stadium 
Passed two street food vendors, a couple of convenience food stands. Lots of police standing around. Bought a ham pastry for €2.3
Checked in at the President hotel around 11:45am. Left my bags 
Walked to a grocery store and bought milk, chocolate, chips 
Bought a charger for my phone, €10
Returned and checked in around 1pm
Went swimming on the 21st floor. Outdoor pool, cold water
Started running into other SoS club members 
Walked to an Indian restaurant, the Red Elephant. Ate chicken butter Masala With roti for €10. 
Slept from 9pm to midnight. 


Wednesday September 7
BWI to Newark 
Newark to Athens 
Watched "The Lobster"
Dinner of yummy chicken 
Watched "x men apocalypse"
Watched "the man who knew infinity"

Arrived in Athens around 11am on Thursday 

Changed $180 USD to €136 @ the airport 
Took metro for €10 from airport to Athens  (acropolis). Found my hostel and left my bags in the luggage area.

€30 for access to the acropolis and other attractions. Spent most of my time at the acropolis people watching 

€1.90 for a liter of milk. Went back to the hostel and moved my bags to my dorm room 
Withdrew €300 cash from an ATM in the metro station 
€7.5 for ok pork meal

Walked over to the Olympieion

€1.90 for a liter of milk. More people watching 

Free shot of ouzo on rooftop bar with great view of the acropolis 
In bed around 6:30am

entry.title: skiing in Colorado, 2017
entry.content:
Monday: Vail. Paid $25 for parking in the garage.
Tuesday: Beaver Creek. My second double black diamond
Wednesday: Breckenridge (solo)
Thursday: Keystone (solo)
Friday

Pro-tip: when at Beaver Creek, order the "locals burrito" at coyote bar for $5 (not listed on the menu)

entry.title: Idaho for graduation ceremony, May 12-19 2015
entry.content:
BWI --> ORD --> SEA --> Spokane, WA --> Moscow, ID

Moscow, ID --> Spokane, WA --> DEN --> BWI

entry.title: skiing in Whistler, Canada 2017
entry.content:
skiing in Whistler

BWI --> DEN --> Vancouver. Bus to Whistler
Bus to Vancouver, flew to ORD --> BWI

rained

injured my knee

entry.title: San Fransico, California 2015
entry.content:
BWI --> SFO
Flew united from bwi at 6am eastern to noon eastern
Left sfo at 9:35am western time
Took Bart to  Embarcadero
walked to Ferry Building, then to pier 39
3pm @ Saturn's house
talked
made supper - turkey burgers with pineapple
Drinks with Dom at club

Saturday
I woke around 7am. Made breakfast for Saturn (scrambled eggs) around 9am
Walked to Asta Yoga for 10am Rocket
Walked to Ferry Building for farmers market. Bought apple cider and apple pastry. Walked to Fisherman's wharf
Street car to Castro district. Hung out with Saturn and his friends @ Lookout
Supper at HiTop bar
Back to Saturns for nap at 8pm
Woke 11pm
Lyft to oasis, $6 (Saturn paid)
Cover  $15
Bought Saturn drink, $18
Mother's started at 1135
Good acts, followed by a few boring, then last was good
Dance until 2am
Taxi home, $7 (Saturn paid)

Sunday April 12
Woke up 7:15am
Made french toast with turkey links
Walked to target, bought yoga mat $17
Bart to Asta Yoga
Ashtanga class with Steve
Bart to hertz on mason street
Drove over golden gate bridge
Parked at Sausalito ferry
Paid for parking to 5:50
Lunch at 1:40 of cod, squid, and fries for $10
40 minute bus ride to Muir Woods visitor  center
There is parking, as Stacey predicted saturday at lookout
Ran up and down trails
Back to bus stop 4:12
